thread.title: Danica Patrick on NASCAR future: 'I don't need an exit strategy'
thread.title_full: Danica Patrick on NASCAR future: 'I don't need an exit strategy'

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Danica Patrick on NASCAR future: 'I don't need an exit strategy'
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Danica Patrick on NASCAR future: 'I don't need an exit strategy' Danica Patrick said her side projects writing fitness books and building a sports apparel line should not be seen as an exit strategy for a NASCAR career. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lAJ3fQ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Danica Patrick on NASCAR future: 'I don't need an exit strategy' Brant James, USA TODAY Sports 4:22 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 CLOSE x Share USA TODAY Sports' Brant James sits down with Fox Sports pit reporter Jamie Little to discuss Danica Patrick's future. Daytona 500 airs Saturday at 1 p.m. ET on Fox. USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick has side projects, such as writing fitness books and building a sports apparel line. (Photo: John David Mercer, USA TODAY Spor) 11 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. — Danica Patrick said her side projects writing fitness books and building a sports apparel line should not be seen as an exit strategy for a NASCAR career. 
“I don’t need an exit strategy. I’ve got plenty of money,” Patrick told USA TODAY Sports. “I do it because I love it. Just like why I’m still racing, because I love it. I don’t have to race if I don’t want to race. 
“Would you sign up for 40 weeks of this if you didn’t want to do it? No way. Nobody does. It’s punishment if you don’t want to be there. I believe in myself and I believe I have things to do in NASCAR.” 
Patrick has finished 24th in each of the past two Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series seasons, with six top-10s — and a career-best of sixth in 2014 at Atlanta — in 154 races. Stewart-Haas Racing competition director Greg Zipadelli expressed confidence in Patrick and second-year crew chief Billy Scott but emphasized she has the equipment to succeed in the No. 10 Ford as she begins her fifth full season at NASCAR’s highest level. 
Patrick’s performance has been scrutinized throughout her career, specifically in relation to the sponsorship funds she has been able to exert as one of racing’s most recognizable and marketable personalities. The recent exodus of primary sponsor Nature’s Bakery has called into question Patrick’s potential longevity if this signals a wane in her power to woo benefactors. Aspen Dental has taken over some of the vacated races but voids remain as the season begins. SHR has filed a breach of contract suit against Nature’s Bakery, which contends Patrick violated terms of their deal by promoting competing products on Instagram. 
MORE NASCAR: Dale Earnhardt Jr. 'scared to death' blurry vision from concussion would end career 
“In business, I’ve learned, unfortunately, you’re going to have challenges and you are going to have situations where you don’t get what you’re supposed to get and it’s just a part of business,” Patrick said. “You can exhaust your energy worrying about it, being mad about it and fighting, it or you can look forward and be positive and cut your losses and move on. For me, that’s more my approach. As far as the legal stuff with Nature’s Bakery, that is on the team side and that is their battle to fight. As far as my situation looking forward, it’s about looking forward and being positive.” 
PHOTOS: Danica Patrick's NASCAR career Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Danica Patrick, born March 25, 1982, in Beloit, Wis., made her NASCAR Nationwide Series debut in 2010 and her Sprint Cup debut in 2012. Michael Thomas Shroyer, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick received primary sponsorship from Nature's Bakery in the 2016 season, but Stewart-Haas Racing sued the snack food company for more than $31 million in early 2017, claiming that Nature's Bakery has reneged on payments. Jerome Miron, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick climbs out of her burning race car after a crash with Matt Kenseth at Talladega Superspeedway on May 1. Patrick called it the worst crash of her career. Marvin Gentry, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick finished 16th at Martinsville Speedway on April 3. Michael Thomas Shroyer, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick pits while qualifying for the Kobalt 400 at Las Vegas Motor Speedway in March 2016. She started 18th. Stephen R. Sylvanie, USA TODAY Sp Danica Patrick flips the coin at the 2015 GoDaddy Bowl between the Arkansas State Red Wolves and the Toledo Rockets at Ladd-Peebles Stadium in Mobile, Ala., on Jan. 4. Michael Chang, Getty Images Danica Patrick finished a Sprint Cup career-best seventh at the 5-Hour Energy 400 at Kansas Speedway on May 10, 2014. Andrew Weber, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick (10) became the first female driver to lead laps at Talladega Superspeedway during the Aaron's 499 on May 4, 2014. Butch Dill, AP Danica Patrick holds Kevin Harvick's son Keelan before the Aaron's 499 at Talladega Superspeedway on May 4, 2014. Rainier Ehrhardt, AP Danica Patrick and country singer Trace Adkins hosted the American Country Awards at the Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino in Las Vegas on Dec. 10, 2013. Frank Micelotta, Invision/AP Danica Patrick (10), the first woman to start from a Cup pole, leads Jeff Gordon (24) to the green flag at the 2013 Daytona 500. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports By virtue of winning the pole, Danica Patrick got to pick the first pit stall for the 2013 Daytona 500. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick waves to the crowd as she is introduced before the 2013 Daytona 500. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick waves to her fans after making NASCAR history by becoming the first woman to win a Sprint Cup pole. Patrick qualified first for the 2013 Daytona 500 on Feb. 17. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick poses with the pole winner sign after becoming the first woman to win the Daytona 500 pole position on Feb. 17, 2013. Chris Graythen, Getty Images Danica Patrick is nothing but smiles as she addresses the media after winning the pole position for the 2013 Daytona 500. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick was the eighth driver out on the track during qualifying for the 2013 Daytona 500. She posted a speed of 196.434 mph, which held up throughout the day. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick prepares before heading out onto the track during qualifying for the 2013 Daytona 500. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick walks from her hauler to her garage during practice for the Daytona 500 on Feb. 17, 2013. Phelan M. Ebenhack, AP Danica Patrick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. went public with their romantic crelationship in early 2013 after rumors swirled about the fellow Sprint Cup rookies. Chris Graythen, Getty Images Danica Patrick applies makeup before a television interview during NASCAR media day at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 14, 2013. John Raoux, AP Danica Patrick gets a hand from her crew as she prepares to take the track for qualifying practice for the 2013 Daytona 500. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images Danica Patrick has formed a tight bond with her team owner and fellow competitor Tony Stewart. Davis Turner for USA TODAY Sports In preparation for her first full season as a Sprint Cup driver, Danica Patrick speaks with the press during the NASCAR Media Tour on Jan. 21, 2013. Jeff Siner, AP Danica Patrick high-fives fans prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series race at Phoenix International Raceway. Ross D. Franklin, AP Danica Patrick (10) lands on top of Paul Menard during a crash on the final lap of the AdvoCare 500 at Phoenix International Raceway. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick behind the wheel during practice for the AdvoCare 500 at Phoenix International Raceway. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick is introduced before the AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race at Texas Motor Speedway. Patrick would go on to finish a career- and season-best 24th. Jerome Miron, US Presswire Danica Patrick takes on tires and fuel during a pit stop at the Nov. 4 AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race. Patrick was one of 25 drivers to finish on the lead lap. Tom Pennington, Getty Images Danica Patrick finished 24th at the AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race at Texas Motor Speedway on Nov. 4. Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick waves to the fans during driver introductions at the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Sept 2, 2012 in Hampton, Georgia. By John Harrelson, Getty Images NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick during qualifying for the AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Aug 31, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Danica Patrick presents the award for Best Team onstage with NBA player Steve Nash at the 2012 ESPY Awards at Nokia Theatre L.A on July 11, 2012. By Kevin Winter, Getty Images Danica Patrick, driver of the #10 GoDaddy.com Chevrolet, leads a group of cars during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series AAA 400 at Dover International Speedway on Sept 30, 2012. By Tom Pennington, Getty Images Fullscreen Pat Summitt, left, head coach emeritus of the Tennessee women's basketball team, greets Danica Patrick before the Food City 250 NASCAR Nationwide Series auto race on Friday, Aug. 24, 2012, in Bristol, Tenn. Summitt was the grand marshal of the race. By Mark Humphrey, AP Danica Patrick starts her car prior to practice for the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series IRWIN Tools Night Race at Bristol Motor Speedway on Aug 24, 2012 in Bristol, Tennessee. By Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images Danica Patrick sits down for an interview with Pardon the Interruption co-hosts Tony Kornheiser, left, and Michael Wilbon on Feb 21, 2012. By H. Darr Beiser, USA Today NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick crashes during the IRWIN Tools Night Race a Bristol Motor Speedway on Aug 25, 2012. By Andrew Weber, US Presswire Danica Patrick waves to fans during driver introductions prior to the start of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 26, 2012 in Daytona Beach, Florida. By Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick waves before throwing out a ceremonial first pitch before a baseball game between the Houston Astros and the Chicago Cubs in Chicago, Sunday, July 1, 2012. By Nam Y. Huh, AP Danica Patrick greets fans on the grid during qualifying for the NASCAR Nationwide Series Dollar General 300 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Oct 12, 2012 in Charlotte, N.C. By Tyler Barrick, Getty Images for NASCAR NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick (left) leads a pack of cars during the AAA 400 at Dover Speedway on Sept 30, 2012. Jerry Lai, US Presswire NASCAR Sprint Cup driver Danica Patrick (10) talks to the media during practice for the Southern 500 at Darlington Raceway on May 11, 2012. By Peter Casey, US Presswire NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick during practice for the Coca-Cola 600 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on May 24, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Danica Patrick during practice for the AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Aug. 31, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Like this topic?
